This game is too hardcore, too realistic.
It's cool, but playing it is painful and tiring.

It's suitable for players who have the patience to spend a lot of time learning and have a strong interest in real military simulations. It's not suitable for players who simply enjoy fast-paced shooting. Arma 3 is a true [u]military simulation[/u], a [u]war simulation[/u], definitely not just a few guns clashing. üëäüëäüëä

While the game didn't meet my personal expectations, this is a great game. While I personally did not enjoy the game as much as expected due to reasons I will soon explain, I can 100% see why people have thousands of hours on this game. Now, I will state the pros and cons of this game from my perspective. 

Pros: The Eden sandbox system, which at least for me, was relatively intuitive and very fun to mess with, but requires a strange order of steps to get the ai to function. The gameplay, which is unlike most other FPS games, requires deliberate thought process and execution with a squad to be successful. Mods, which are probably the primary attraction to most people, allow you to customize the game to your desire. The community and players of the game, which are some of the best of any game I have played, are super cool and almost everyone knows their stuff and has a mic.

Cons: THE DLCs!!! The DLCs are infuriating to me, it is almost like an EA game. You want to use an RPG-7, an AKM, or a tank? Too bad, your $30 was not enough to buy that and now you need to spend ANOTHER $25+ just to be able to play normally. The lack of players in vanilla servers is another drawback, and as a new player, modding the game can be a bit confusing or scary if you are not already familiar with the process. I know it is an old game, so I really should not need to explain that the graphics are not exactly high quality, but that is a given for the age. 

Conclusion: This is a great game, and I would not hesitate to recommend it to someone, but the mods and the learning curve can be difficult to understand for new players. Also, the DLCs are a major disappointment since you can not play how you want to without them (although mods may be able to fix that, but I have not played with them too much).

Arma is the videogame equivalent of an action figure playset. You make your own fun, and that often means putting up with a good deal of setup time and pain. When it works though, you can do almost anything you want to within the grounds of a tactical shooter.

The game does include singleplayer content that is generally enjoyable, but the real meat of the game is starting a server with friends to play a variety of game modes, or cooperating with a unit of players for larger scale action. Most of these you can download, but you can also build and script your own missions with the in-game mission editor, which can be fun if you're into that sort of design work. Whether you've just got an afternoon to kill or want to play an epic game taking place over many multi-hour sessions, Arma has something you'll enjoy.

The game has a lot of useful guides and info on how to play, but it is pretty in depth. You're going to want to keep a list of default keybinds handy, and maybe watch some videos online on how to handle gameplay using the more widely-used mods like ACE.

Pretty much all the content people like to use is easily downloaded either through Steam Workshop or a number of 3rd party sites. Word to the wise: Have an additional 10-30 GB of drive space available on top of the recommended system requirements to dedicate to mods.

‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ ‚ÄúARMA 3 ‚Äì A Beautiful, Terrible, Soul-Eating Disaster‚Äù

If you‚Äôve ever wondered what it feels like to experience hope, disappointment, and emotional collapse in the span of a single loading screen ‚Äî ARMA 3 is here to personally walk you through all five stages of grief.

The game promises ‚Äúrealistic military simulation.‚Äù
What it actually delivers is a slideshow of pain, broken physics, and an AI that could lose a chess match against a Roomba.

üéÆ Performance?

Performance? Oh sweet summer child.
ARMA 3 runs like it was coded on a calculator submerged in yogurt.
You can have a NASA supercomputer powered by the heart of a dying star ‚Äî doesn‚Äôt matter.
ARMA 3 will STILL find a way to give you 27 FPS in an empty field at sunrise.

ü§ñ AI ‚Äì Artificial Idiocy

Imagine commanding a squad of highly trained soldiers.
Now replace them with eight lobotomized pigeons wearing helmets.
Congratulations, you now understand ARMA 3‚Äôs squad behavior.

‚ÄúGo prone!‚Äù
They stand.
‚ÄúHold fire!‚Äù
They nuke an entire village.
‚ÄúRegroup!‚Äù
They wander into a minefield because the voices told them to.

üßç‚ôÇÔ∏è Physics: A Comedy Special

Get shot once and your character performs a 2008 YouTube ragdoll montage.

Helicopters crash if you breathe too loudly.

üï≥Ô∏è Bugs

ARMA 3 doesn‚Äôt have bugs.
ARMA 3 is a bug with some game accidentally attached to it.

Animations so stiff they make Minecraft villagers look like ballet dancers.

üó∫Ô∏è The World

I have more then 600 hours into this game and I hate it more, the more I play it. I also have played Arma 2 in the past and Arma 3 really, really was not that good to begin with. But the idea was more then 10 years ago that BI would use the shitload of money they got from DayZ mods popularity (increasing Arma 2 sales) and later increased Arma 3 sales into much more development.
Arma 3 truly sucks in almost any and every way. It is very, very much an infantry simulator from 2003 that has been released a decade after that. 
Vehicle physics don't make any sense and in my opinion were sometimes better in Arma 2. Planes and helicopters are a total nightmare and most of all, the GODAWFUL performance issues and lack of optimization is really what drives me up a wall. No way in hell that I will ever bother with any other BI game ever again. 
DCS, MS Flight sim, maybe even a whole list of other games have got flight controls and modeling down. Not Arma. Not in the slightest.
World of Tanks, or any other game will be able to simulate armored vehicles a million times better.
Arma also does not explore the use of a navy or naval assets, they are somehow irrelevant. Again, god knows how many other games do this better.
The only upside to Arma 3 many, many years ago was that you could modify it. But the quality of the mods is mostly, absolute, definitive, garbage.
